panels.title: Records Lag Max
panels.description: The maximum lag in terms of number of records for any partition in this window. An increasing value over time is your best indication that the consumer group is not keeping up with the producers.

panels.title: Records Lag Max
panels.description: The maximum lag in terms of number of records for any partition in this window. An increasing value over time is your best indication that the consumer group is not keeping up with the producers.

panels.title: Fetch Requests per second
panels.description: The number of fetch requests per second.

panels.title: Active Connections
panels.description: The current number of active connections.

panels.title: Ingestion Delay
panels.description: Difference between current time and timestamp on the latest event produced

panels.title: Ingestion Delay
panels.description: Difference in seconds between current time and timestamp on the latest event produced

panels.title: Bytes per second
panels.description: The average number of bytes consumed per second.

panels.title: Records per second
panels.description: The average number of records consumed per second.

panels.title: Average Num Bytes Fetched Per Request
Average Latency Per Fetch Request
panels.description: The average time taken for a fetch request.

panels.title: Max Latency Per Fetch Request
panels.description: The max time taken for a fetch request.

panels.title: Group Join Rate per second
panels.description: The number of group joins per second. Group joining is the first phase of the rebalance protocol. A large value indicates that the consumer group is unstable and will likely be coupled with increased lag.

panels.title: Heartbeat Rate per second
panels.description: The average number of heartbeats per second. After a rebalance, the consumer sends heartbeats to the coordinator to keep itself active in the group.

panels.title: Last Heartbeat
panels.description: The number of seconds since the last controller heartbeat.

panels.title: I/O Time per select call
panels.description: The average length of time for I/O per select call in nanoseconds.

panels.title: Network I/O per second
panels.description: The average number of network operations (reads or writes) on all connections per second.

panels.title: Bytes In / Out / Rejected (1 minte rate)
